unnormalised: **Manufacturing & Supply Chain: Inventory Forecasting Takes Center Stage**
normalised: manufacturing and supply chain inventory forecasting takes center stage

unnormalised: Mumbai, India – Robust inventory forecasting is becoming increasingly crucial for manufacturers across India, particularly as they grapple with fluctuating demand and supply chain disruptions. A recent report from the Indian Institute of Management, Bangalore (IIM-B) highlights that companies leveraging AI-powered forecasting tools experienced a 15% reduction in inventory holding costs within the first six months.

unnormalised: “Optimizing inventory levels is no longer a luxury, but a necessity,” stated Dr. Priya Sharma, lead researcher at IIM-B. “Accurate demand predictions allow businesses to avoid both stockouts and excessive stockpiles, significantly impacting profitability.”

The shift towards predictive analytics is expected to intensify, with projections showing a market size of Rs. 500 Crores for forecasting solutions by 2025. Industry experts will discuss these trends at the "Supply Chain Innovation Summit" scheduled for 10:00 hrs on October 26, 2023, in New Delhi. Early bird registration closes on 15/09/2023.
